clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Evaluation of the Treatment of Spider Angioma
clinical_study.official_title: A Clinical Evaluation of the Treatment of Spider Angioma Using a Dual Wavelength Laser Emitting 532 nm Laser Energy

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the safety and effectiveness of the laser treatment for the treatment of spider angiomas.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of the 532 nm KTP laser within the Cutera Excel V system for the treatment of spider angiomas.

primary_outcome.measure: The investigator will perform a baseline assessment of the spider angiomas and compare the degree of improvement for each treated lesion at 4 weeks post-final treatment using the Physician's Global Assessment scale.
primary_outcome.description: assessment of Baseline vs. 4 weeks post-final treatment for improvement of spider angiomas

secondary_outcome.measure: At 4 weeks post-final treatment, subjects will be asked to rate their level of satisfaction with the laser treatment outcome and the overall laser treatment procedure, using the Subject Satisfaction Assessment Scale.
secondary_outcome.description: Subject satisfaction assessment of laser outcome and procedure at 4 weeks post-final treatment

arm_group.description: Each subject will receive a 532 nm KTP laser treatment for their spider angioma(s).

intervention.description: Dual Wavelength Laser Emitting 532 nm Laser Energy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Males or females, 5 to 65 years of age (inclusive).
2. Fitzpatrick Skin Types I-IV
3. Subject must be able to read, understand and sign the Informed Consent Form.
4. If subject is a minor (<18 years old in Illinois), Assent must be obtained from the subject and a Parental Consent Form must be signed by the parents or legal guardian.
5. Subject must be willing and able to adhere to the treatment and follow-up schedule and post-treatment care instructions.
6. Willing to have limited sun exposure for the duration of the study, including the follow-up period.
7. Willingness to have digital photographs taken of their spider angioma(s) and agree to use of photographs for presentation, educational or marketing purposes
8. Agree not to undergo any other procedure for the treatment of spider angioma during the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Pregnant.
2. History of pigmentary disorders, particularly tendency for hyper- or hypo-pigmentation.
3. Having a known anti-coagulative condition or taking anticoagulation medications, including aspirin.
4. History of seizure disorders due to light.
5. Systemic use of isotretinoin (AccutaneÂ®) within 6 months of study participation.
6. Excessively tanned in areas to be treated or unable/unlikely to refrain from tanning during the study.
7. Participation in a study of another device or drug within 3 months prior to enrollment or during the study.
8. In the opinion of the investigator, any physical or mental condition which might make it unsafe for the subject to participate in this study or which requires systemic therapy that could interfere with this research study.
